results.content:
Stay away from this. There are better courses for beginners with instructors who do know React. As for Next, you will learn more from free on the excellent official tutorial (Nextjs site). Note to future self, a course that’s 12+ hours long (this one is 30+) is always a waste of time. People who know their business go straight to the point without wasting you days.

Finally, I wouldn’t even bother to post a review if it wasn’t for the instructor removing questions that he doesn’t like. That lack of integrity in my world is unacceptable.
results.content_html:
Stay away from this. There are better courses for beginners with instructors who do know React. As for Next, you will learn more from free on the excellent official tutorial (Nextjs site). results.content: Still in the beginning but really wanted to mention how painfully small coding window is. It requires a lot of focus to watch what instructor is typing in the editor. The course itself is brilliant with amazing instructor but I don't know how far I can go before I get a headache at looking at tiny lines of code. I want to finish it as fast as I can, but looks like it is gonna be a drag, as I would have to take frequent breaks from it to refresh my eyes. I beg the instructor to please make use of zooming feature while recording. I want to give it a high rating as everything else is great about this course, but forcing myself to look away from it to take frequent breaks, breaks my concentration which is a big no no for me.

results.content:
The material and explanations from the instructor are very good. He highlights common mistakes you may run into and shows multiple approaches to achieve desired functionality. 

Knowledge of the very basics of HTML and JavaScript will help you follow along and is something I would recommend as basic syntax is not explained.

The only issue I have found with the course so far is visibility of text in the video. If you are planning on working through this course on a laptop screen with a split view between the video and your editor, be prepared to squint a bit.
results.content_html:

results.content: This is an excellent course, the instructor is enthusiastic and knowledgeable and conveys this well in his lessons. He responds to queries in the Q&A in a short period of time and generally has good comments which extend the course knowledge. More seasoned programmers may find his explanations of why things go where a bit drawn out, but these are also good refresher points for some of us that need them. I'd recommend this course for people beginner to advanced, with a lot of detail and explanantions.

results.content:
I enrolled in this class to learn about next.js but actually I intuitively learnt a lot of different topics. For example, you will learn how to debug your code, how to use chrome tools, advanced css,  advanced react.js and much more. this is not just a next.js course, this will prepare you how to think as a software engineer.     
      Filip is a great instructor.  Since next.js-9 is released, he updated his course in 2-3 weeks as he promised. He explains everything in details and if you still have questions he answers your questions so fast.  so if you are a dedicated student, by the end of this course you will be amazed by how much you improved yourself. 
  after next.js 9 update, he now updated for serverless next.js. amazing
results.content_html:

results.content:
Very poor flow
Not maintain any sequence?
Setting up the existing Gitproject & all Heroku setup at very initial is more confusing

A proper sequence should be created

Found comparatively better & very less duration tutorial on YouTube which starts from fundamental & then explaining each aspect properly
Got the money wasted. Wish I can get refund

results.content:
I rate this course very highly:
- Advantages :
+ The project of the course is quite large, it can completely be listed on the CV, unlike 90% of the Udemy courses the projects are very small, so it cannot be listed in the CV.
+ Filip answers the questions of students very enthusiastically, which is completely different from the 90% of other lecturers on Udemy.

- Points to improve:
+ To fully understand this course you need to read more documentation from the Next.js homepage, Filip's explanation is not clear, if he has some examples or illustrations it will be very great.

+ Some functions for the project are missing such as validate, image update, loading sppiner, 404 pages,  if this is improved I will rate 5 stars for him.
results.content_html:
I rate this course very highly:
- Advantages :
+ The project of the course is quite large, it can completely be listed on the CV, unlike 90% of the Udemy courses the projects are very small, so it cannot be listed in the CV.
+ Filip answers the questions of students very enthusiastically, which is completely different from the 90% of other lecturers on Udemy.

- Points to improve:
+ To fully understand this course you need to read more documentation from the Next.js homepage, Filip's explanation is not clear, if he has some examples or illustrations it will be very great.

+ Some functions for the project are missing such as validate, image update, loading sppiner, 404 pages, if this is improved I will rate 5 stars for him.

results.content:
This course is excellent. At the end you will have a beautiful website. 
And if you are a little patient, Filip is going to use all the last version of frameworks. 

I asked two times his help during the course, he replied a few hours after very fast. 

He explains everything in details and help you to think in a good way with a good logic. 
During this course, you will learn a lot and you will have a beautiful website at the end.
Thank you so much for this course and your help !

results.content:
WOW!! The instructor has expert knowledge about the subject and can present his knowledge-base in a project-driven, code-along format that is easy to follow and understand.

This course is detailed and yet concise, which I much appreciate. I enjoyed it and can't wait to implement the knowledge I gained. The course was updated just recently, which I really appreciated. Thanks for this great course! :)

results.content: Filip Jerga is very knowledgeable in what he was teaching. His explanations were clear and concise. I appreciated the organic approach to teaching where he showed his debugging process when things went wrong. Looking forward to the bonus content update!

results.content: This is an incredibly thorough and helpful course that allows students not only to learn but to have a really nice project by the end of the course. The instructor did a great job explaining everything and making more considerations than I usually see in these courses such as performance enhancements and more complete bug fixes. He was also very quick to respond to any questions and very engaging. I 100% would recommend to anyone interested and look forward to future tutorials from this instructor.

results.content:
Initially, course starts with Nextjs tutorial and Filip starts explaining terms and concepts more details which is helpful for beginners.

By the end of the course, you learn to build nice looking portfolio application with all details of styled jsx and API integration to third party services. This is super useful including the understanding of how to deploy NextJs app to production.

Good explanation of SSR vs CSR, which is important for learning Nextjs.

Filip is also very responsive on his slack channel and answers queries of many students promptly.

Great job Filip! Enjoyed and learnt a lot about NextJs. Highly recommend it to anyone who want to use Nextjs to build web app.
results.content_html:

By the end of the course, you learn to build nice looking portfolio application with all details of styled jsx and API integration to third party services. This is super useful including the understanding of how to deploy NextJs app to production.

Good explanation of SSR vs CSR, which is important for learning Nextjs.

Filip is also very responsive on his slack channel and answers queries of many students promptly.

Great job Filip! Enjoyed and learnt a lot about NextJs. Highly recommend it to anyone who want to use Nextjs to build web app.

results.content: Great Course
results.content_html: Great Course

results.content: Seriously? Have to setup 3 (!, in words: three) accounts to start up this lesson. If I havn't a GitHub account it would be 4. GitHub, MongoDB Atlas, heroku and Auth0. Muah! This is a mess. Furthermore you should put some sensible data like passwords in your app, which repositiory is a public one. One accidental 'git push' and the security of your accounts is gone. Muah!

response.content:
Hello Alexander 
Thank you for feedback. Much Appreciated ! (: I am sorry to hear you are not satisfied with the course.

All of the following was introduced in introduction video and description of the course. I would suggest to pay more attention to requirements of the course next time.

Github is not requirement  you are able to complete course without it.

There is not much materials about auth0 that's why I have included it into the course. Auth0 is pretty safe and easy to include as authentication.

If you want to work on real application, manage your data, persist your data then DB is must have. My choice was Mongo atlas, it's one of the easies to use Databases out there.

I am not sure about "One accidental 'git push' and the security of your accounts is gone. Muah!". All of the passwords are kept in files that are not included on github and in environment variables that are not exposed and following best practices of security.

I would be happy to help you with the course. If you have additional questions or something is not clear you are also welcome in Slack channel. 
Cheers.
Filip
response.content_html:
Hello Alexander
Thank you for feedback. Much Appreciated ! (: I am sorry to hear you are not satisfied with the course.

All of the following was introduced in introduction video and description of the course. I would suggest to pay more attention to requirements of the course next time.

Github is not requirement you are able to complete course without it.

There is not much materials about auth0 that's why I have included it into the course. Auth0 is pretty safe and easy to include as authentication.

If you want to work on real application, manage your data, persist your data then DB is must have. My choice was Mongo atlas, it's one of the easies to use Databases out there.

I am not sure about "One accidental 'git push' and the security of your accounts is gone. Muah!". All of the passwords are kept in files that are not included on github and in environment variables that are not exposed and following best practices of security.

I would be happy to help you with the course. If you have additional questions or something is not clear you are also welcome in Slack channel.
Cheers.
Filip

results.content_html: Seriously? Have to setup 3 (!, in words: three) accounts to start up this lesson. If I havn't a GitHub account it would be 4. GitHub, MongoDB Atlas, heroku and Auth0. Muah! This is a mess. Furthermore you should put some sensible data like passwords in your app, which repositiory is a public one. One accidental 'git push' and the security of your accounts is gone. Muah!
